column4: Hi all, since Ubuntu 10.04 when I start the system MySQL hangs. I know it has been upgraded to an upstart job. I'm trying to stop it but can't do anything. What shall I do?

have you tried purging MySQL from your system with the package manager. then say, doing an 'updatedb' and then using 'locate' to try and find if there's still leftover myswl stuff on your system that needs to be deleted, and then finally reinstalling mysql?
no I haven't. I'm going to give it a try
